title: KLEDS Q IS AN AMAZING IDEA
body:
i love how it shows the circle you have to be in.

now can we do that for karma and lb? honestly i dont even think the tether would land where i was standing and yet it streches further

EDIT: also nocturnes and fiddles tether

replies.body: Applying some of these new techniques to older champs is always a good idea. I especially like that the Kled Q circle only shows to him and the target (minimizing noise to other players).
can we give Kennen a range indicator on his W? Like the one Twitch has on his E and Lee Sin has on his Q?

Can anivia ult get an indicator for herself? It's frustrating to lose teamfights because you accidentally walked 1 inch too far away.
Also, why is Orianna's indicator for her ball a colored arrow? This feels awkward to me and is less precise than a circle. There already is a circle when it's on an ally. I think it would be simpler if it was always a circle.
These indicators are only for the champ itself and represent the most important parts of their kit. I think they deserve a proper indicator.

Just the thoughts from someone who occasionally gets to play these champs in ARAM but doesn't master them. I'm interested to hear what anivia/orianna mains think.
anivia sorta has one. she ges a exclamation mark if your close. ori gets the arrow that changes colors too

Oh, I never noticed the exclamation mark. Anyways, just like the changing colors, it's not really precise. A thin circle like with the other abilities is not only more precise, it's also better for the sake of consistency throughout the game. Why does one champs' tether have an arrow while another one has an exclamation mark and the rest have a thin circle?

Tbh the red arrow for orianna is pretty useless because I know roughly the range, but not quite exactly. I know that when it's yellow that I'm still far off even without the arrow.
As a incoming Ori main I'd rather it stay in arrow. Although the arrow may be imprecise the circle would just look weird (like new Shens sword) and yeah. I'd prefer the arrows over added precision

It was about anivia.

> anivia sorta has one. she ges a exclamation mark if your close.

The game has a lot of clarity issues as it stands. Letting us see LB and Karma's tether range is a start.
If they show tether range shouldn't they have to show all grab ranges then?

Tether range isn't grab range though. A Tether is something that latches on for a few seconds and then brings an effect with it later (usually cc), but you can step outside the range and be free from it. A grab is a straight line skillshot with immediate CC attached along with displacement.

Tethers include: {{champion:25}} R,   {{champion:43}} E,   {{champion:56}} E,   {{champion:7}} E,   {{champion:9}} W and more that I can't recall right now.

honestly if you ever played nocturne, you start to see how important lading your e is , the range is kinda small,so a fast champ, should be able to out run it easly , or champs like lb can just dash away , regardless, nocturne doesnt need any more nerfs

to put in a short notice: nocturne is a hit or miss champ
you either get the kill or you dont, and the champ walks away
ofc you have your ult, but the cd on it is unreliable in that matter

No one is saying he should get a nerf. They are just saying that the range of the tether should be shown on champions that tether, like nocturne, so that you can better make decisions. Right now there is no indicator.

I'm not saying this invalidates your point, but Kled's tether is different from the others because it changes size. That is, the tether radius gets smaller over time. Without the circle indicator it would be impossible to know that fact without reading it somewhere. Just saying, none of the other tethers have as strong of a need for indicators.

Additional thought: We don't get range indicators for any other enemy abilities, what makes tether-range indicators more deserving of screen space?

For one, tether's counterplay is to break the tether.  Knowing where you have to move to do that is pretty fucking important.

Additionally, the other tethers do change range.  The distance you have to move to break them is different from their initial cast range-- Sure, they are less dynamic than Kled's, but their range still changes.
Morgana's R has that too, very helpful. I'd say Karma and LB better have it too

it kinda does, as the color gets darker,so does the time in order for the root to go off
it should be obvious in that matter , karma has the same, her resolve, gets more darker the closer it gets to the root

Tether indicators aren't meant to convey the time-delay, but rather the range needed to break the chain. the coloration on Karma's W, the Sound effects on Lb's E, these help their characters know WHEN the root will take place, but what we're talking about is How FAR you need to go to either maintain the connection, or break it altogether.

Wondering why this didn't come up with Riot when they were discussing Kleds development...

You'd think adding an indicator to improve counterplay on his tether would at least warrant a discussion and then hopefully evolve into new tether indicators for everyone..Something tells me they like LB being unfair though, only explanation I can think of, and unless they say otherwise, thats probably going to be my opinion.
LB tether is a skillshot. it's supposed to be rewarded to land. Kled only has an indicator because his is Dynamic and changes size.
Kled's is a skillshot too...Which is always rewarding to land and stay in Range, identical to LB.
Yes.. but it is dynamic and changes size so it's required for his. please read my above comment.
It also goes through minions making it easier to land
We also need this for Fiddleysticks
Right, let's give 2 of the highest cheese champs in the game even more cheese...
If your opponent is also able to see it, then I think it would be a nerf to those champs.

Not exactly. Tether indicators are great instances of communicating counterplay to both the caster and their target. For instance take Morg and Kledd, who both have tether indicators right now. Since the enemy can see how far he has to go to get out of the tether, he's able to make a more informed decision as to if he wants to flash or use a mobility tool to get out in time. Morg and Kledd however, get the added benefit of seeing how close they need to keep in order to maintain the tether, allowing them more mobile freedom, and better awareness if their tethers are likely to be broken.

Yes, in theory it's equal for both parties but the opponent is less likely to know the exact range than someone who plays the champion, because especially in (high elo) ranked, when someone plays a champion, you expect them to know the mechanics of that champ.

I'm confused. The point of Tether indicators is that both you *and* the person being tethered see the range. You're argument works for how it is *now*, in which players who know tether ranges can abuse that information that their opponents might not know.

The entire point of the range indicator is to make it so that both parties are aware of the exact tether range, so they can both work with/against it.
